Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2009 09:35PM stayingstrong wrote: LuAnn, It sounds like you and your MDs are on top of things and have been quite successful thus far; so, I would trust in their opinion and your own "gut feeling".  You are so knowledgeable about this "dreaded disease"  that I believe you will make the right decision.  I will keep you in my prayers and send positive vibes your way.
Posts.Title: Progression on scans - need advice LuAnnH mom2acat

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2009 09:55AM stayingstrong wrote: I had several lymph node lesions with extensive bone mets and was treated with Taxotere/Cytoxan/Zometa for eight rounds - everything seemed stable; so, was put on Femara/Zometa.  For sixteen months that seemed to be working; but, yesterday found out that I have thirty(30) lymph node lesions and forty(40) small lesions in my liver - my liver looks like swiss cheese, I guess.  Oncologist started me back on Taxotere/Cytoxan/Zometa.  I hope this will work and I will be able to go back on a hormonal again sometime.  I also had my hip rebuilt and a rod(pelvis-knee) placed in my femur in September.  I hope the Femara works for you - I sure enjoyed being on it and getting my hair back and my feet neuropathy gone.
Posts.Title: PET/CT shows bone and liver mets marshakb nancyc

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2012 01:39PM stayingstrong wrote: This discussion is from five years ago.  How do these old posts seem to be appearing more often lately?  Out of respect for the members we have lost to this awful disease, please check the dates of the post or if the member is still posting before replying.  Thank You!!!
Posts.Title: bit stressed Tracy1964 bhd1

Posts.Content: May 28, 2009 06:53AM stayingstrong wrote: I want to thank all of you for replying to my call for advice.  I did go to the ER and found out I was severely anemic - was admitted to the hospital and received five units of blood.  I was discharged late last evening, feeling 100% better.  I am so very grateful to all of you and this Board to rely on.  I can't say thank you enough; but, all my best to everyone.  Vicki
Posts.Title: Heart Racing/Shortness of Breath stayingstrong Alpal

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2011 08:03PM stayingstrong wrote: I am happy for all of you to have this resource.  I encourage everyone who is still working to look into this - I had my life insurance through my work and was in really bad shape when finally diagnosed - was out on sick leave and not able to return to work.  I received nothing - went on Cobra for health insurance and also paid for small life insurance while on it; but, when it ran out due to time and Medicare kicking in the Life Insurance was gone also.  This is not a "poor me" or "pity request" just a heads up for everyone.
Posts.Title: Accelerated Life Insurance - Do it if you can!!! Irishbrat Heidihill

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2011 09:01PM stayingstrong wrote: I'm sorry you are having such a run of bad times - hope things improve for you soon.  You didn't say what your concerns with new floor/kinks are; but, I wanted to mention there are patient advocates available that could maybe assist you.  Your concern should be you.  Hope you feel better quickly and can get home to your family.
